content:
Hello everyone !

I have a point about referencing an ig to the registry that is not clear for me. We are currently working on an oncology implementation guide (see https://fhir.arkhn.com/osiris/) and we are wondering about publishing it on registry.fhir.org.
Is the IG publishing process explained on confluence related to the publication on the fhir registry or are they two distinct things ?
In my comprehension, the ig publishing process is to develop hl7 official ig, right ?

https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/FHIR+Implementation+Guide+Process+Flow

thanks in advance for your answer !
Hi @Nicolas Riss | Arkhn - there are some pointers here - https://registry.fhir.org/submit

Thanks @Brian Kaney ! So, I can make a pull request on fhir-ig-list.json file without following the publication process flow explained there : https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/FHIR+Implementation+Guide+Process+Flow ?
